question: Which President of India has been bestowed with Mexico's highest civilian award?
explanation: On 1st June 2019, Ex-President Pratibha Patil has been  conferred the \"Orden Mexicana del Aguila Azteca\" (Order of the Aztec Eagle) in the MCCIA Bhavan, Pune. It is the highest civilian award of Mexico given to foreigners in recognition of their outstanding services to strengthening the bilateral ties between Mexico and other countries and outstanding services to the Mexican nation or humanity.  Patil, Indiaâ€™s first woman President (2007-2012), became only the 2nd Indian head of state to get the award. Earlier, the late President S Radhakrishna had been conferred this honour.
